verb.description: Turn the crankshaft of (an internal combustion engine) in order to start the engine.
Give a bend to (a shaft, bar, etc.).

noun.description: A part of an axle or shaft bent out at right angles, for converting reciprocal to circular motion and vice versa.

adjective.description: (of a sailing ship) easily keeled over, especially by wind or sea through improper design or loading.

origin: Early 17th century: perhaps from dialect crank weak, shaky (compare with cranky or crank).
